meanings.definition: To speak louder or more forcefully than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the argument, she outvoices her brother to make her point.
meanings.sent2: She always outvoices her friends when they sing together.
meanings.sent3: At the concert, the quiet mouse surprisingly outvoices the roaring lion.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outvoices her fears is like a powerful wave crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The little bird outvoices the chirping crickets in the early morning.

meanings.definition: To surpass in vocal ability or volume.
meanings.sent1: The opera singer outvoices all others with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent2: He practices every day to outvoices his own singing from yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The tiny frog outvoices the big bullfrog in the pond with its high-pitched croak.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outvoices the joyful sounds of a children's playground.
meanings.sent5: The thunder outvoices the gentle rain with its booming presence.
